 1348: shell_help(Config) ->
 1349:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1350:     try
 1351:         send_tty(Term, "application:put_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, false).\n"),
 1352:         send_tty(Term, "lists"),
 1353:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1354:         %% Check we can see the first line
 1355:         check_content(Term, "List processing functions."),
 1356:         check_not_in_content(Term, "less than or equal to"),
 1357:         %% Expand the help area to take up the whole buffer.
 1358:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1359:         %% Check that we can see the last line (lists help should fit in the window)
 1360:         check_content(Term, "less than or equal to"),
 1361:         send_tty(Term, ":all"),
 1362:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1363:         check_content(Term, ~S"all\(Pred, List\)"),
 1364:         ok
 1365:     after
 1366:         stop_tty(Term),
 1367:         ok
 1368:     end.
 1369: %% Test the we can handle invalid ansi escape chars.
 1370: %%   tmux cannot handle this... so we test this using to_erl
 1371: shell_invalid_ansi(_Config) ->
 1372: 
 1373:     InvalidAnsiPrompt =
 1374:         case proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts(user)) of
 1375:             unicode ->
 1376:                 ["\e]94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e]0m"];
 1377:             latin1 ->
 1378:                 ["\e]94minvalid_test\e]0m"]
 1379:         end,
 1380: 
 1381:     rtnode:run(
 1382:       [{eval, fun() -> application:set_env(
 1383:                          stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1384:                          fun() -> InvalidAnsiPrompt end)
 1385:               end },
 1386:        {putline,"a."},
 1387:        {expect, "a[.]"},
 1388:        {expect, ["\\Q",InvalidAnsiPrompt,"\\E"]}],
 1389:       "", "",
 1390:       ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1391:        "-connect_all","false",
 1392:        "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1393:        "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1394:        "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1395:        "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1396:       ]).
 1397: 
 1398: shell_get_password(_Config) ->
 1399:    
 1400:     rtnode:run(
 1401:       [{putline,"io:get_password()."},
 1402:        {putline,"secret\r"},
 1403:        {expect, "\r\n\"secret\""}]),
 1404: 
 1405:     rtnode:run(
 1406:         [{eval,fun() -> shell:start_interactive({noshell, raw}) end},
 1407:         {eval,
 1408:             fun() ->
 1409:                 io:format(user, "Enter password: ", []),
 1410:                 spawn(fun() -> io:format(user, "~nPassword was: ~ts~n",[io:get_password(user)]) end),
 1411:                 ok
 1412:             end},
 1413:         {expect, "Enter password: "},
 1414:         {putline,"secret"},
 1415:         {expect, "^\nPassword was: secret\n"}],
 1416:         "", "", ["-noshell"]),
 1417: 
 1418:     %% io:get_password only works when run in "newshell", or "noshell/raw"
 1419:     rtnode:run(
 1420:       [{putline,"io:get_password()."},
 1421:        {expect, "\\Q{error,enotsup}\\E"}],
 1422:      "","",["-oldshell"]).
 1423: 
 1424: 
 1425: shell_ignore_pager_commands(Config) ->
 1426:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1427:     case code:get_doc(file, #{sources=>[eep48]}) of
 1428:         {error, _} -> {skip, "No documentation available"};
 1429:         _ ->
 1430:             try
 1431:                 send_tty(Term, "h(file).\n"),
 1432:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qmore (y/n)? (y)\\E"),
 1433:                 send_tty(Term, "n\n"),
 1434:                 check_content(Term,"ok"),
 1435:                 send_tty(Term, "C-P"),
 1436:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qh(file).\\E"),
 1437:                 ok
 1438:             after
 1439:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1440:                 ok
 1441:             end
 1442:     end.
 1443: test_valid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1444:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1445:     Term = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "valid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1446:     set_tty_prompt(Term, Config),
 1447:     try
 1448:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid key"),
 1449:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid function"),
 1450:         send_tty(Term, "asdf"),
 1451:         send_tty(Term, "C-u"),
 1452:         check_content(Term, ">$"),
 1453:         send_tty(Term, "1.\n"),
 1454:         send_tty(Term, "C-b"),
 1455:         check_content(Term, "2>\\s1.$"),
 1456:         ok
 1457:     after
 1458:         stop_tty(Term),
 1459:         ok
 1460:     end.
 1461: 
 1462: test_invalid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1463:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1464:     Term1 = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "invalid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1465:     set_tty_prompt(Term1, Config),
 1466:     try
 1467:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid key"),
 1468:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid function"),
 1469:         send_tty(Term1, "asdf"),
 1470:         send_tty(Term1, "C-u"),
 1471:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
 1472:         ok
 1473:     after
 1474:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1475:         ok
 1476:     end.
 1477: external_editor(Config) ->
 1478:     case os:find_executable("nano") of
 1479:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1480:         _ ->
 1481:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1482:             try
 1483:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1484:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1485:                 send_tty(Term, "\"some text with\nnewline in it\""),
 1486:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1487:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"),
 1488:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1489:                 check_content(Term,"\"some text with\\s*\n\\s*newline in it\""),
 1490:                 send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1491:                 send_tty(Term, "still"),
 1492:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1493:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1494:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1495:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1496:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"still\\s*\n\\s*.+\\s*some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1497:                 send_tty(Term,".\n"),
 1498:                 check_content(Term,"\\Q\"still\\nsome text with\\nnewline in it\"\\E"),
 1499:                 ok
 1500:             after
 1501:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1502:                 ok
 1503:             end
 1504:     end.
 1505: 
 1506: external_editor_visual(Config) ->
 1507:     case os:find_executable("vim") of
 1508:         false ->
 1509:             {skip, "vim is not installed"};
 1510:         _ ->
 1511:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1512:             try
 1513:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1514:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1515:                 check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1516:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"VISUAL\",\"vim -u DEFAULTS -U NONE -i NONE\").\n"),
 1517:                 check_content(Term, "4>"),
 1518:                 send_tty(Term,"\"hello"),
 1519:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% Open vim
 1520:                 check_content(Term, "^\"hello"),
 1521:                 send_tty(Term, "$"), %% Set cursor at end
 1522:                 send_tty(Term, "a"), %% Enter insert mode at end
 1523:                 check_content(Term, "-- INSERT --"),
 1524:                 send_tty(Term, "\"."),
 1525:                 send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1526:                 send_tty(Term,":wq"),
 1527:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1528:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\"[.]$"),
 1529:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1530:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\""),
 1531:                 check_content(Term, "5>$")
 1532:             after
 1533:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1534:                 ok
 1535:             end
 1536:     end.
 1537: 
 1538: external_editor_unicode(Config) ->
 1539:     NanoPath = os:find_executable("nano"),
 1540:     case NanoPath of
 1541:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1542:         _ ->
 1543:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1544:             try
 1545:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1546:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1547:                 send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1548:                 check_content(Term,"3> " ++ hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1549:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% open external editor (nano)
 1550:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1551:                 send_tty(Term, "still "),
 1552:                 check_content(Term,"\nstill "),
 1553:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1554:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1555:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1556:                 check_content(Term,"still "++hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1557:                 ok
 1558:             after
 1559:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1560:                 ok
 1561:             end
 1562:     end.
 1563: 
 1564: %% There used to be a race condition when using shell:start_interactive where
 1565: %% the newline handling of standard_error did not change correctly to compensate
 1566: %% for the tty changing to canonical mode
 1567: shell_standard_error_nlcr(Config) ->
 1568: 
 1569:     [
 1570:      begin
 1571:          Term = setup_tty([{env,[{"TERM",TERM}]},{args, ["-noshell"]} | Config]),
 1572:          try
 1573:              rpc(Term, io, format, [standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", []]),
 1574:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest$"),
 1575:              rpc(Term, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(),
 1576:                                 io:format(standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", [])
 1577:                        end),
 1578:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest(\n|.)*test\ntest\ntest")
 1579:          after
 1580:              stop_tty(Term)
 1581:          end
 1582:      end || TERM <- ["dumb",os:getenv("TERM")]].
 1583: 
 1584: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1585: shell_suspend(Config) ->
 1586: 
 1587:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1588:     %% In order to suspend `erl` we need it to run in a shell that has job control
 1589:     %% so we start the peer within a tmux window instead of having it be the original
 1590:     %% process.
 1591:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1592: 
 1593:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1594:               post_process_args =>
 1595:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1596:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs =
 1597:                                       lists:join(
 1598:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1599:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1600:                         end
 1601:             },
 1602: 
 1603: 
 1604:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1605: 
 1606:     try
 1607:         send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1608:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1609:         send_tty(Term, "C-Z"),
 1610:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1611:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1612:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1613:         send_tty(Term, "M-l"),
 1614:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1615:         check_location(Term,{0,width(hard_unicode())}),
 1616:         ok
 1617:     after
 1618:         stop_tty(Term),
 1619:         ok
 1620:     end.
 1621: 
 1622: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1623: shell_full_queue(Config) ->
 1624: 
 1625:     [throw({skip,"Need unbuffer (apt install expect) to run"}) || os:find_executable("unbuffer") =:= false],
 1626: 
 1627:     %% In order to fill the read buffer of the terminal we need to get a
 1628:     %% bit creative. We first need to start erl in bash in order to be
 1629:     %% able to get access to job control for suspended processes.
 1630:     %% We then also wrap `erl` in `unbuffer -p` so that we can suspend
 1631:     %% that program in order to block writing to stdout for a while.
 1632: 
 1633:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1634:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1635: 
 1636:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1637:               post_process_args =>
 1638:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1639:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1640:                                       lists:join(
 1641:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1642:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1643:                         end
 1644:             },
 1645: 
 1646: 
 1647:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1648:     UnbufferedPid = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term,os,getpid,[])),
 1649: 
 1650:     WriteUntilStopped =
 1651:         fun F(Char, Term) ->
 1652:                 rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char],[]]),
 1653:                 put(bytes,get(bytes,0)+1),
 1654:                 receive
 1655:                     stop ->
 1656:                         rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char+1],[]])
 1657:                 after 0 -> F(Char, Term)
 1658:                 end
 1659:         end,
 1660: 
 1661:     WaitUntilBlocked =
 1662:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
 1663:                 (fun F(Cnt) ->
 1664:                          receive
 1665:                              {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} = Down ->
 1666:                                  ct:fail({io_format_did_not_block, Down})
 1667:                          after 1000 ->
 1668:                                  ok
 1669:                          end,
 1670:                          case process_info(Pid,dictionary) of
 1671:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,Cnt}]} ->
 1672:                                  ct:log("Bytes until blocked: ~p~n",[Cnt]),
 1673:                                  %% Add one extra byte as for
 1674:                                  %% the current blocking call
 1675:                                  Cnt + 1;
 1676:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,NewCnt}]} ->
 1677:                                  F(NewCnt)
 1678:                          end
 1679:                  end)(0)
 1680:         end,
 1681: 
 1682:     try
 1683:         %% First test that we can suspend and then resume
 1684:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1685:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1686:         {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($a, Term) end),
 1687:         WaitUntilBlocked(Pid, Ref),
 1688:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1689:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1690:         Pid ! stop,
 1691:         check_content(Term,"b\\s+\\([^)]*\\)2>$")
 1692:     after
 1693:         stop_tty(Term),
 1694:         ok
 1695:     end,
 1696:     Name2 = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config))++"_2",
 1697:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name2 ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1698: 
 1699:     Peer2 = #{ name => Name2,
 1700:               post_process_args =>
 1701:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1702:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1703:                                       lists:join(
 1704:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1705:                                 ["send","-t",Name2,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1706:                         end
 1707:             },
 1708: 
 1709:     Term1 = setup_tty([{peer, Peer2},{args, ["-noshell"]}|Config]),
 1710:     UnbufferedPid1 = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term1,os,getpid,[])),
 1711:     try
 1712:         %% Then we test that all characters are written when system
 1713:         %% is terminated just after writing
 1714:         {ok,Cols} = rpc(Term1,io,columns,[user]),
 1715:         send_tty(Term1, "Enter"),
 1716:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid1),
 1717:         check_content(Term1,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1718:         {Pid2, Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($c, Term1) end),
 1719:         Bytes = WaitUntilBlocked(Pid2, Ref2) - 1,
 1720:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1721:         send_tty(Term1, "fg"),
 1722:         send_tty(Term1, "Enter"),
 1723:         check_content(
 1724:           fun() ->
 1725:                   tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term1)])
 1726:           end, lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(Cols,$c) ++ "\n" ||
 1727:                                  _ <- lists:seq(1,(Bytes) div Cols)]
 1728:                              ++ [lists:duplicate((Bytes) rem Cols,$c)])),
 1729:         ct:log("~ts",[tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])]),
 1730:         ok
 1731:     after
 1732:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1733:         ok
 1734:     end.
 1735: 
 1736: get(Key,Default) ->
 1737:     case get(Key) of
 1738:         undefined ->
 1739:             Default;
 1740:         Value ->
 1741:             Value
 1742:     end.
 1743: 
 1744: %% A list of unicode graphemes that are notoriously hard to render
 1745: hard_unicode() ->
 1746:     ZWJ =
 1747:         case os:type() of
 1748:             %% macOS has very good rendering of ZWJ,
 1749:             %% but the cursor does not agree with it..
 1750:             {unix, darwin} -> [];
 1751:             _ -> [[16#1F91A,16#1F3FC]]    % Hand with skintone 🤚🏼
 1752:         end,
 1753:     [[16#1f600],             % Smilie 😀
 1754:     "한",                   % Hangul
 1755:     "Z̤͔ͧ̑̓","ä͖̭̈̇","lͮ̒ͫ","ǧ̗͚̚","o̙̔ͮ̇͐̇" %% Vertically stacked chars
 1756:      %%"👩‍👩",            % Zero width joiner
 1757:      %%"👩‍👩‍👧‍👦"                % Zero width joiner
 1758:      | ZWJ].
 1759: 
 1760: hard_unicode_match(Config) ->
 1761:     ["\\Q",[unicode_to_octet(Config, U) || U <- hard_unicode()],"\\E"].
 1762: 
 1763: unicode_to_octet(Config, U) ->
 1764:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1765:         unicode -> U;
 1766:         latin1 -> unicode_to_octet(U)
 1767:     end.
 1768: 
 1769: unicode_to_octet(U) ->
 1770:     [if Byte >= 128 -> [$\\,integer_to_list(Byte,8)];
 1771:         true -> Byte
 1772:      end || <<Byte>> <= unicode:characters_to_binary(U)].
 1773: 
 1774: unicode_to_hex(Config, U) ->
 1775:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1776:         unicode -> U;
 1777:         latin1 -> unicode_to_hex(U)
 1778:     end.
 1779: 
 1780: unicode_to_hex(U) when is_integer(U) ->
 1781:     unicode_to_hex([U]);
 1782: unicode_to_hex(Us) ->
 1783:     [if U < 128 -> U;
 1784:         U < 512 -> ["\\",integer_to_list(U,8)];
 1785:         true -> ["\\x{",integer_to_list(U,16),"}"]
 1786:      end || U <- Us].
 1787: 
 1788: width(C, Str) ->
 1789:     case ?config(encoding, C) of
 1790:         unicode -> width(Str);
 1791:         latin1 -> width(unicode_to_octet(Str))
 1792:     end.
 1793: width(Str) ->
 1794:     lists:sum(
 1795:       [npwcwidth(CP) || CP <- lists:flatten(Str)]).
 1796: 
 1797: npwcwidth(CP) ->
 1798:     try prim_tty:npwcwidth(CP)
 1799:     catch error:undef ->
 1800:             if CP =:= 16#D55C ->
 1801:                     2; %% 한
 1802:                CP =:= 16#1f91A ->
 1803:                     2; %% hand
 1804:                CP =:= 16#1F3Fc ->
 1805:                     2; %% Skintone
 1806:                CP =:= 16#1f600 ->
 1807:                     2; %% smilie
 1808:                true ->
 1809:                     case lists:member(CP, [775,776,780,785,786,787,788,791,793,794,
 1810:                                            804,813,848,852,854,858,871,875,878]) of
 1811:                         true ->
 1812:                             0;
 1813:                         false ->
 1814:                             1
 1815:                     end
 1816:             end
 1817:     end.
 1818: 
 1819: tmux([Cmd|_] = Command) when is_list(Cmd) ->
 1820:     tmux(lists:concat(Command));
 1821: tmux(Command) ->
 1822:     string:trim(os:cmd(["tmux ",Command])).
 1823: 
 1824: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, Fun) ->
 1825:     erpc:call(N, Fun).
 1826: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, M, F, A) ->
 1827:     erpc:call(N, M, F, A).
 1828: 
 1829: %% Setup a TTY, or a ssh server and client but do not type anything in terminal (except password)
 1830: setup_tty(Config) ->
 1831:     ClientName = maps:get(name,proplists:get_value(peer, Config, #{}),
 1832:                     peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path, Config))),
 1833: 
 1834:     PG = get_top_parent_test_group(Config),
 1835:     Name = if PG =:= ssh ->
 1836:             ClientName ++ "_ssh";
 1837:         true ->
 1838:             ClientName
 1839:     end,
 1840:     Envs = lists:flatmap(fun({Key,Value}) ->
 1841:                                  ["-env",Key,Value]
 1842:                          end, proplists:get_value(env,Config,[])),
 1843: 
 1844:     ExtraArgs = proplists:get_value(args,Config,[]),
 1845: 
 1846:     ExecArgs = case os:getenv("TMUX_DEBUG") of
 1847:                    "strace" ->
 1848:                        STraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1849:                                                  Name++".strace"),
 1850:                        ct:log("Link to strace: file://~ts", [STraceLog]),
 1851:                        [os:find_executable("strace"),"-f",
 1852:                         "-o",STraceLog,
 1853:                         "-e","trace=all",
 1854:                         "-e","read=0,1,2",
 1855:                         "-e","write=0,1,2"
 1856:                        ] ++ string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all);
 1857:                    "rr" ->
 1858:                        [os:find_executable("cerl"),"-rr"];
 1859:                    _ ->
 1860:                        string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all)
 1861:                end,
 1862:     DefaultPeerArgs = #{ name => Name,
 1863:                          exec =>
 1864:                              {os:find_executable("tmux"),
 1865:                               ["new-window","-n",Name,"-d","--"] ++ ExecArgs },
 1866: 
 1867:                          args => ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1868:                                   "-connect_all","false",
 1869: %                                  "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1870:                                   "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1871:                                   "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1872:                                   "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1873:                                  ] ++ Envs ++ ExtraArgs,
 1874:                          wait_boot => 60_000,
 1875:                          detached => false
 1876:                        },
 1877: 
 1878:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
 1879:         ?CT_PEER(maps:merge(proplists:get_value(peer,Config,#{}),
 1880:                             DefaultPeerArgs)),
 1881: 
 1882:     Self = self(),
 1883: 
 1884:     %% By default peer links with the starter. For these TCs we however only
 1885:     %% want the peer to die if we die, so we create a "unidirection link" using
 1886:     %% monitors.
 1887:     spawn(fun() ->
 1888:                   TCRef = erlang:monitor(process, Self),
 1889:                   PeerRef = erlang:monitor(process, Peer),
 1890:                   receive
 1891:                       {'DOWN',TCRef,_,_,Reason} ->
 1892:                           exit(Peer, Reason);
 1893:                       {'DOWN',PeerRef,_,_,_} ->
 1894:                           ok
 1895:                   end
 1896:           end),
 1897:     unlink(Peer),
 1898: 
 1899:     "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",Name," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1900: 
 1901:     %% We start tracing on the remote node in order to help debugging
 1902:     TraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),Name++".trace"),
 1903:     ct:log("Link to trace: file://~ts",[TraceLog]),
 1904: 
 1905:     spawn(Node,
 1906:           fun() ->
 1907:                   {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file,TraceLog),
 1908:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv),[c,m]),
 1909:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_writer),[c,m]),
 1910:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_reader),[c,m]),
 1911:                   %% dbg:tp(user_drv,x),
 1912:                   %% dbg:tp(prim_tty,x),
 1913:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,write_nif,x),
 1914:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,read_nif,x),
 1915:                   monitor(process, Self),
 1916:                   receive _ -> ok end
 1917:           end),
 1918:     Tmux = #tmux{ peer = Peer, node = Node, name = ClientName },
 1919:     if PG =:= ssh ->
 1920:             rpc(Tmux, fun() ->
 1921:                 ssh:start(),
 1922:                 PrivDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "nopubkey"),
 1923:                 file:make_dir(PrivDir),
 1924:                 SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1925:                 {ok, _Sshd} = ssh:daemon(8989, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1926:                                     {user_dir, PrivDir},
 1927:                                     {password, "bar"}])
 1928:             end),
 1929:             os:cmd(os:find_executable("tmux") ++ " new-window -n " ++ ClientName ++ " -d -- "++
 1930:                 "ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null localhost -p 8989 -l foo"),
 1931:             "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",ClientName," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1932: 
 1933:             timer:sleep(2000),
 1934:             check_content(Tmux,"Enter password for \"foo\""),
 1935:             "" = tmux("send -t " ++ ClientName ++ " bar Enter"),
 1936:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1937:             check_content(Tmux,"\\d+\n?>"),
 1938:             Tmux#tmux{ ssh_server_name = Name };
 1939:         true ->
 1940:             Tmux
 1941:     end.
 1942: 
 1943: get_top_parent_test_group(Config) ->
 1944:     maybe
 1945:         GroupPath = proplists:get_value(tc_group_path,Config),
 1946:         [_|_] ?= GroupPath,
 1947:         [{name, Group2}] ?= lists:last(GroupPath),
 1948:         Group2
 1949:     else
 1950:         _ -> proplists:get_value(name,
 1951:                                  proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,
 1952:                                                                 Config))
 1953:     end.
 1954: 
 1955: set_tty_prompt(Term, Config) ->
 1956:     PG = get_top_parent_test_group(Config),
 1957: 
 1958:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1959:     Prompt1 = proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt),
 1960: 
 1961:     if PG =:= ssh ->
 1962:             erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1963:                 [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test, Prompt1]);
 1964:         true ->
 1965:             erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1966:                 [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test, Prompt1])
 1967:     end.
 1968: 
 1969: %% Start a tty, setup custom prompt and set cursor at bottom
 1970: start_tty(Config) ->
 1971: 
 1972:     Term = setup_tty(Config),
 1973: 
 1974:     set_tty_prompt(Term, Config),
 1975: 
 1976:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1977: 
 1978:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 1979:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 1980:     %% position is.
 1981:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 1982: 
 1983:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 1984:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 1985:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 1986:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 1987:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 1988:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 1989: 
 1990: prompt(L) ->
 1991:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 1992:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1993:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 1994:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 1995: 
 1996: stop_tty(Term) ->
 1997:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 1998:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 1999:     [ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term#tmux{ name = Term#tmux.ssh_server_name }, "-e")])
 2000:       || Term#tmux.ssh_server_name =/= undefined],
 2001: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 2002:     ok.
 2003: 
 2004: tty_name(Term) ->
 2005:     Term#tmux.name.
 2006: 
 2007: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 2008:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 2009:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 2010:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 2011: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 2012:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 2013:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 2014: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 2015:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 2016:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 2017:     [begin
 2018:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 2019:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 2020:      end || V <- Quotes].
 2021: 
 2022: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 2023: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 2024: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
 2025:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 2026: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 2027:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 2028: 
 2029: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 2030:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 2031: check_location(Term, Where, Attempt) when is_tuple(Where) ->
 2032:     check_location(Term, [Where], Attempt);
 2033: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 2034:                Where, Attempt) ->
 2035:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 2036:     case lists:any(fun({AdjRow, AdjCol}) ->
 2037:                            {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} =:= NewLocation
 2038:                    end, Where) of
 2039:         true -> NewLocation;
 2040:         false when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2041:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 2042:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,Where},
 2043:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 2044:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 2045:         false ->
 2046:             timer:sleep(50),
 2047:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 2048:     end.
 2049: 
 2050: get_location(Term) ->
 2051:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 2052:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 2053:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 2054: 
 2055: get_window_size(Term) ->
 2056:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 2057:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 2058:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 2059: 
 2060: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 2061:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 2062: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 2063:     Opts = #{},
 2064:     OrigContent = case Term of
 2065:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 2066:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 2067:     end,
 2068:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 2069:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 2070:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 2071:                 error ->
 2072:                     OrigContent
 2073:                 end,
 2074:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 2075:         {match,_} ->
 2076:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 2077:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 2078:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 2079:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 2080:             ct:fail(match);
 2081:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2082:             ok;
 2083:         _ ->
 2084:             timer:sleep(500),
 2085:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 2086:     end.
 2087: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 2088:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 2089: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 2090:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 2091: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 2092:     OrigContent = case Term of
 2093:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 2094:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 2095:               end,
 2096:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 2097:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 2098:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 2099:                   error ->
 2100:                       OrigContent
 2101:               end,
 2102:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 2103:         {match,_} ->
 2104:             ok;
 2105:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2106:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 2107:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 2108:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 2109:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 2110:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 2111:         _ ->
 2112:             timer:sleep(500),
 2113:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 2114:     end.
 2115: 
 2116: get_content(Term) ->
 2117:     get_content(Term, "").
 2118: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 2119:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 2120:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 2121:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 2122:             C;
 2123:         [C] ->
 2124:             C
 2125:     end.
 2126: 
 2127: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 2128: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2129:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2130: 	old ->
 2131:             test_exit_initial(old);
 2132:         new ->
 2133:             test_exit_initial(old),
 2134:             test_exit_initial(new)
 2135:     end,
 2136:     ok.
 2137: 
 2138: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 2139:     rtnode:run(
 2140:       [{putline, ""},
 2141:        {putline, "2."},
 2142:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 2143:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2144:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2145:        {putline, ""},
 2146:        {putline, "35."},
 2147:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 2148:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 2149: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 2150:     rtnode:run(
 2151:       [{putline, ""},
 2152:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2153:        {putline, "2."},
 2154:        {expect, "2"},
 2155:        {putline,"exit()."},
 2156:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2157:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2158:        {putline, "35."},
 2159:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 2160: 
 2161: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2162:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 2163:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 2164:         {error, Reason} ->
 2165:             {skip, Reason};
 2166:         Tempdir ->
 2167:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 2168:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 2169:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 2170:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 2171:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 2172:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 2173:             ok
 2174:     end.
 2175: 
 2176: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 2177: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 2178: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 2179: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 2180: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 2181: %% on the current line.
 2182: %%
 2183: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 2184: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 2185: %% newline to happen.
 2186: %%
 2187: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 2188: %% we should.
 2189: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2190:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2191:         new ->
 2192:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 2193:             rtnode:run(
 2194:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 2195:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 2196:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2197:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 2198:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2199:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 2200:               ],
 2201:               [],
 2202:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 2203:         _ ->
 2204:             ok
 2205:     end,
 2206:     ok.
 2207: 
 2208: noshell_raw(Config) ->
 2209: 
 2210:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2211:         new ->
 2212: 
 2213:             TCGl = group_leader(),
 2214:             TC = self(),
 2215: 
 2216:             TestcaseFun = fun() ->
 2217:                                   link(TC),
 2218:                                   group_leader(whereis(user), self()),
 2219: 
 2220:                                   try
 2221:                                     %% Make sure we are in unicode encoding
 2222:                                     unicode = proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts()),
 2223: 
 2224:                                     "\fhello\n" = io:get_line("1> "),
 2225:                                     ok = shell:start_interactive({noshell, raw}),
 2226: 
 2227:                                     %% Test that we can receive 1 char when N is 100
 2228:                                     [$\^p] = io:get_chars("2> ", 100),
 2229: 
 2230:                                     %% Test that we only receive 1 char when N is 1
 2231:                                     "a" = io:get_chars("3> ", 1),
 2232:                                     "bc" = io:get_chars("", 2),
 2233: 
 2234:                                     %% Test that get_chars counts characters not bytes
 2235:                                     ok = io:setopts([binary]),
 2236:                                     ~b"å" = io:get_chars("4> ", 1),
 2237:                                     ~b"äö" = io:get_chars("", 2),
 2238: 
 2239:                                     %% Test that echo works
 2240:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, true}]),
 2241:                                     ~b"åäö" = io:get_chars("5> ", 100),
 2242:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, false}]),
 2243: 
 2244:                                     %% Test that get_line works
 2245:                                     ~b"a\n" = io:get_line("6> "),
 2246: 
 2247:                                     %% Test that get_until works
 2248:                                     ~b"a,b,c" = io:request({get_until, unicode, "7> ", ?MODULE, get_until, []}),
 2249: 
 2250:                                     %% Test that we can go back to cooked mode
 2251:                                     ok = shell:start_interactive({noshell, cooked}),
 2252:                                     ~b"abc" = io:get_chars(user, "8> ", 3),
 2253:                                     ~b"\n" = io:get_chars(user, "", 1),
 2254: 
 2255:                                     io:format("exit")
 2256:                                   catch E:R:ST ->
 2257:                                     io:format(TCGl, "~p", [{E, R, ST}])
 2258:                                   end
 2259:                           end,
 2260: 
 2261:             rtnode:run(
 2262:               [
 2263:                {eval, fun() -> spawn(TestcaseFun), ok end},
 2264: 
 2265:                {expect, "1> $"},
 2266:                {putline, "hello"},
 2267: 
 2268:                {expect, "2> $"},
 2269:                {putdata, [$\^p]},
 2270: 
 2271:                {expect, "3> $"},
 2272:                {putdata, "abc"},
 2273: 
 2274:                {expect, "4> $"},
 2275:                {putdata, ~b"åäö"},
 2276: 
 2277:                {expect, "5> $"},
 2278:                {putdata, ~b"åäö"},
 2279:                {expect, "åäö$"},
 2280: 
 2281:                {expect, "6> $"},
 2282:                {putdata, "a\r"}, %% When in raw mode, \r is newline.
 2283: 
 2284:                {expect, "7> $"},
 2285:                {putline, "a"},
 2286:                {sleep, 10},
 2287:                {putline, "b"},
 2288:                {sleep, 10},
 2289:                {putdata, "c."},
 2290: 
 2291:                {expect, "8> $"},
 2292:                {putline, "abc"},
 2293:                {expect, "abc\r\n$"},
 2294: 
 2295:                {expect, "exit$"}
 2296:               ], [], [],
 2297:               ["-noshell","-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]);
 2298:         _ -> ok
 2299:     end,
 2300:     ok.
 2301: 
 2302: get_until(start, NewChars) ->
 2303:     get_until([], NewChars);
 2304: get_until(State, NewChars) ->
 2305:     Chars = State ++ NewChars,
 2306:     case string:split(Chars, ".") of
 2307:         [Chars] -> {more, Chars ++ ","};
 2308:         [Before, After] -> {done, [C || C <- Before, C =/= $\n], After}
 2309:     end.
 2310: 
 2311: 
 2312: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 2313: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 2314: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 2315: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 2316: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 2317: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 2318: %% commands.
 2319: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2320:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 2321:     rtnode:run(
 2322:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 2323:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 2324:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2325:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 2326:        {putline, "echo3."},
 2327:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 2328:        {putline, "echo4."},
 2329:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 2330:        {putline, "echo5."},
 2331:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 2332:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2333:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2334:     rtnode:run(
 2335:       [{sleep,100},
 2336:        {putline, ""},
 2337:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 2338:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2339:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2340:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 2341:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2342:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2343:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2344:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2345:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2346:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2347:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 2348:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 2349:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 2350:       ], [], [],
 2351:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2352:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2353: 
 2354:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2355:     rtnode:run(
 2356:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2357:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2358:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2359:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2360:        ], [], [],
 2361:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2362:     ok.
 2363: 
 2364: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2365:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2366:     rtnode:run(
 2367:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2368:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2369:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2370:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2371:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2372:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2373: 
 2374:     {ok, Logs} =
 2375:         rtnode:run(
 2376:           [{sleep,100},
 2377:            {putline, ""},
 2378:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2379:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2380:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2381:            {expect, "echo"}
 2382:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2383:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2384: 
 2385:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2386:       "erlang.log.1",
 2387:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2388:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2389: 
 2390:     ok.
 2391: 
 2392: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2393:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2394:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2395:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2396:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2397:     try
 2398:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2399:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2400: 
 2401:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2402:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2403:             rtnode:run(
 2404:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2405:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2406:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2407: 
 2408:         ct:log("~p",[Logs1]),
 2409:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2410: 
 2411:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2412:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2413:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2414:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2415:             rtnode:run(
 2416:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2417:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2418:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2419: 
 2420:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2421: 
 2422:     after
 2423:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2424:     end,
 2425:     ok.
 2426: 
 2427: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2428:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2429: 
 2430:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2431:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2432: 
 2433:     {ok, Logs} =
 2434:         rtnode:run(
 2435:           [{putline, ""},
 2436:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2437:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2438:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2439:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2440: 
 2441:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2442:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2443:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2444:                       false,
 2445:                       Logs),
 2446:     ok.
 2447: 
 2448: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2449:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2450: 
 2451:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2452:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2453: 
 2454:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2455:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2456:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2457:     ok = file:close(D),
 2458: 
 2459:     {ok, Logs} =
 2460:         rtnode:run(
 2461:           [{putline, ""},
 2462:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2463:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2464:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2465:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2466: 
 2467:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2468:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2469:                       Logs),
 2470:     ok.
 2471: 
 2472: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2473:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2474: 
 2475:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2476:     rtnode:run(
 2477:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2478:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2479:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2480:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2481:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2482: 
 2483:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2484:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2485:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2486:     ok = file:close(D),
 2487: 
 2488:     {ok, Logs} =
 2489:         rtnode:run(
 2490:           [{putline, ""},
 2491:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2492:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2493:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2494:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2495:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2496: 
 2497:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2498:     ok.
 2499: 
 2500: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2501: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2502:     try
 2503:         rtnode:run(
 2504:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2505:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2506:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2507:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2508:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2509:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2510:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2511:     catch
 2512:         _:_ ->
 2513:             ok
 2514:     end.
 2515: 
 2516: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2517:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2518:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2519: 
 2520: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2521:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2522:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2523:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2524:     ].
 2525: 
 2526: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2527:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2528:     rtnode:run(
 2529:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2530:        %% {putline, ""},
 2531:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2532:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2533:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2534:        {putline, "echo."},
 2535:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2536:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2537:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2538:     ok.
 2539: 
 2540: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2541: 
 2542:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2543:     %% provider module.
 2544:     rtnode:run(
 2545:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2546:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2547:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2548:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2549: 
 2550:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2551:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2552:     rtnode:run(
 2553:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2554:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2555:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2556:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2557:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2558: 
 2559:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2560:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2561:     rtnode:run(
 2562:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2563:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2564:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2565:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2566:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2567: 
 2568:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2569:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2570:     rtnode:run(
 2571:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2572:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2573:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2574:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2575:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2576:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2577: 
 2578:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2579:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2580:     rtnode:run(
 2581:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2582:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2583:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2584:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2585:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2586:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2587: 
 2588:     ok.
 2589: 
 2590: shell_history_toggle(_Config) ->
 2591: 
 2592:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2593:     %% provider module.
 2594:     rtnode:run(
 2595:       [
 2596:        {putline, "io:setopts(user, [{line_history, true}])."},
 2597:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"},
 2598: 
 2599:        %% Test that io:get_line does not save into history buffer
 2600:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("").'},
 2601:        {putline, ~s'hello'},
 2602:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2603:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2604:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("").\\E'},
 2605:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2606:        {expect, ~s'> $'},
 2607: 
 2608:        %% Test that io:get_line does save into history buffer when enabled
 2609:        {putline, "io:setopts([{line_history, true}])."},
 2610:        {expect, "ok\r\n"},
 2611:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("> ").'},
 2612:        {putline, ~s'hello again'},
 2613:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello again\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2614:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2615:        {expect, ~s'hello again'},
 2616:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2617:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("> ").\\E'},
 2618:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2619:        {expect, ~s'hello again'},
 2620:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2621:        {expect, ~s'> $'},
 2622: 
 2623:        %% Test that io:get_line does not save into history buffer when disabled
 2624:        {putline, "io:setopts([{line_history, false}])."},
 2625:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("| ").'},
 2626:        {putline, ~s'hello'},
 2627:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2628:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2629:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("| ").\\E'},
 2630:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2631:        {expect, ~s'> $'}
 2632:       ], [], [], ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2633: 
 2634:         ok.
 2635: 
 2636: load() ->
 2637:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2638:         {ok, crash} ->
 2639:             error(crash);
 2640:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2641:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2642:             ok;
 2643:         _ ->
 2644:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2645:     end.
 2646: 
 2647: add(_Line) ->
 2648:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2649:         {ok, crash} ->
 2650:             error(crash);
 2651:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2652:             %% Should return ok
 2653:             {error, badreturn};
 2654:         _ ->
 2655:             io:format("!", [])
 2656:     end.
 2657: 
 2658: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2659: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2660:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2661: 	old ->
 2662: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2663: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2664: 	new ->
 2665: 	    %% New shell tests
 2666: 	    rtnode:run(
 2667:               [{putline, ""},
 2668:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2669:                {putline, "2."},
 2670:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2671:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2672:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2673:                {putline, "s"},
 2674:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2675:                {putline, "c"},
 2676:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2677:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2678:                {putline, "35."},
 2679:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2680:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2681:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2682:                {sleep, 6000},
 2683:                {expect, "Command is taking a long time"},
 2684:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2685:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2686:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2687:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2688:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2689:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2690:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2691:                {putline, "c"},
 2692:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2693:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2694:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2695:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2696:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2697:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2698:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2699:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2700:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2701:                {putline, "k"},
 2702:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2703:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2704:                {putline, "c"},
 2705:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2706:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2707:                {putline, "i"},
 2708:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2709:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2710:                {putline, "?"},
 2711:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2712:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2713:                {putline, "h"},
 2714:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2715:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2716:                {putdata, "\t"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2717:                {sleep, 100},
 2718:                {putline, ""},
 2719:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2720:                {putdata, "\^r"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2721:                {sleep, 100},
 2722:                {putline, ""},
 2723:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2724:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2725:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2726:                {putline, "35."},
 2727:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2728:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2729:               ]),
 2730:             ok
 2731:     end.
 2732: 
 2733: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2734: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2735:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2736: 	old ->
 2737: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2738: 	_ ->
 2739:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2740:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2741:             try
 2742:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2743:             after
 2744:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2745:             end
 2746:     end.
 2747: 
 2748: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2749: %% -noshell node.
 2750: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2751:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2752: 	old ->
 2753: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2754: 	_ ->
 2755: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2756:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2757:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2758:             try
 2759:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2760:             after
 2761:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2762:             end
 2763:     end.
 2764: 
 2765: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2766:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2767:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2768:                                    receive die ->
 2769:                                            ok
 2770:                                    end
 2771:                            end),
 2772:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2773:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2774:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2775:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2776: 
 2777:     rtnode:run(
 2778:       [{putline, ""},
 2779:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2780:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2781:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2782:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2783:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2784:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2785:        {putline, "j"},
 2786:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2787:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2788:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2789:        {putline, "c"},
 2790:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2791:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2792:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2793:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2794:        {expect, PidStr},
 2795:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2796:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2797:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2798:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2799:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2800:        {putline, "j"},
 2801:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2802:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2803:        {putline, "c"},
 2804:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2805:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2806:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2807:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2808:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2809:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2810:        {putline, "j"},
 2811:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2812:        {putline, "c"},
 2813:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2814:        {sleep, 100},
 2815:        {putline, "35."},
 2816:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2817:       ], RemNode),
 2818:     Pid ! die,
 2819:     ok.
 2820: 
 2821: %% Tests various control keys.
 2822: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2823:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2824:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2825:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2826:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2827:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2828:     rtnode:run(
 2829:       [{putline,""},
 2830:        {putline,"2."},
 2831:        {expect,"2"},
 2832:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2833:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2834:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2835:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2836:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2837:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2838:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2839:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2840:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2841:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2842:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2843:     ok.
 2844: 
 2845: wordLeft() ->
 2846:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2847:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2848:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2849:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2850: 
 2851: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2852:     End = "\eOF",
 2853:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2854:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2855: 
 2856: wordRight() ->
 2857:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2858:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2859:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2860:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2861: 
 2862: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2863:     Home = "\eOH",
 2864:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2865:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2866: 
 2867: %% Test that -remsh works
 2868: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2869:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2870:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2871:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2872: 
 2873:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2874:                {putline,"node()."},
 2875:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2876: 
 2877:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2878: 
 2879:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2880:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2881:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2882:     rtnode:run(
 2883:       PreCmds ++
 2884:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2885:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2886:           PostCmds,
 2887:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2888: 
 2889:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2890:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2891: 
 2892:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2893:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2894:                [], " ",
 2895:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2896: 
 2897:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2898: 
 2899:     ok.
 2900: 
 2901: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2902: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2903:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2904:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2905: 
 2906: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2907:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2908:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2909:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2910:      {putline, "s"},
 2911:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2912:      {putline, "c"},
 2913:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2914:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2915: 
 2916: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2917: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2918:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2919:     Domain =
 2920:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2921:             [] ->
 2922:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2923:             _ -> ""
 2924:         end,
 2925:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2926:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2927:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2928:             try
 2929:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2930:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2931:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2932:                 try
 2933:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2934:                            SNode,
 2935:                            STPid,
 2936:                            [{putline, ""},
 2937:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2938:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2939:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2940:                            CNode,
 2941:                            CTPid,
 2942:                            [{putline, ""},
 2943:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2944:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2945:                 after
 2946:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2947:                 end
 2948:             after
 2949:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2950:             end;
 2951:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2952:             Else
 2953:     end.
 2954: 
 2955: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2956: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2957:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2958:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2959:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2960:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2961:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2962:             try
 2963:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2964:                        SNode,
 2965:                        STPid,
 2966:                        [{putline, ""},
 2967:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2968:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2969:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2970:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2971:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2972:                 try
 2973:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2974:                            CNode,
 2975:                            CTPid,
 2976:                            [{putline, ""},
 2977:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2978:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2979:                 after
 2980:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2981:                 end
 2982:             after
 2983:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2984:             end;
 2985:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2986:             Else
 2987:     end.
 2988: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2989:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2990:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2991:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2992:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2993:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2994:             try
 2995:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2996:                        STPid,
 2997:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2998:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2999:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3000:             after
 3001:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 3002:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 3003:             end;
 3004:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 3005:     end.
 3006: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3007:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 3008:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 3009:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 3010:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 3011:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 3012:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 3013:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 3014:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 3015:                     try
 3016:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 3017:                             STPid,
 3018:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 3019:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 3020:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3021:                     after
 3022:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 3023:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 3024:                     end;
 3025:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 3026:             end
 3027:     end.
 3028: 
 3029: printed_atom(A) ->
 3030:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
